newsitem.title: UK: Gold demand in 1996 reached 2,642 tonnes -WGC.
newsitem.headline: Gold demand in 1996 reached 2,642 tonnes -WGC.

text.p: Gold demand last year totalled 2,642 tonnes in countries monitored by the World Gold Council (WGC), the WGC said on Wednesday.
Consumption was only four percent down on the record set the previous year as investment demand in the returned to more normal levels, the WGC said.

"Gold demand in 1996 remained very close to the previous year's record high level, in spite of a drop in investment demand. The overall 1996 performance is a testament to the strength of jewellery demand which reached a new record last year," the WGC said.
Jewellery consumption totalled 2,242 tonnes just above the previous record set the year before and remained robust in early 1997, the WGC said.

Gold demand increased in the Middle East and the developing markets of Asia and Latin America as well as in the U.S. and Europe. But demand in Japan fell 41 percent against 1995 as investment interest declined.

Investors rejected gold as the strong U.S. dollar prevented weaker gold prices translating into lower values in domestic currencies, said the WGC, which monitors areas accounting for about 75 percent of world gold demand.
